titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Edith M. Crouse autograph book 1978.035
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:18:56 +0000.

did.abstract: The autograph book of Brooklyn resident Edith M. Crouse, who lived at 214 Lincoln Place. The entries in the book appear to have been written by friends and classmates, and many are signed "Class of 1888."

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Edith M. Crouse autograph book, 1978.035, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. The item was formally accessioned in 1978.

controlaccess.geogname: Brooklyn (New York, N.Y.) -- Social life and customs -- 19th century
